title: Lesson 79
paragraph: Access and behavior affect interactions. Proper alignment, ethical usage, and respecting mutual rights maintain harmony and accountability.

words.meaning: the ability to approach or use something
words.example: Students have access to the library.
The children were behaveable during the show.
The images are aligned on the page.

words.meaning: shared by two or more parties
words.example: They have a mutual respect for each other.
Correct usage of the tool is important.
The evidence implicated him in the crime.

words.meaning: a list of items to be discussed
words.example: The meeting agenda included budget review.

words.meaning: to refer to as evidence or example
words.example: She cited several sources in her essay.
We honor veterans on this day.

words.meaning: able to be challenged or requested for review
words.example: The decision is appealable in court.
